main event: A bright, star-like object was observed in the sky over Cabot, Arkansas on May 22, 1967 at around 11:02 PM.
interesting points: The object appeared as a large star, sometimes spoon-shaped, with lights on the top and one on the bottom.
The object was about five times the size of a star and bluish-white in color.
The object was much brighter than a typical star.
The object was observed for around 1 hour and 40 minutes before the observer stopped watching.
The report concludes that the object was likely a planet or satellite, though anything else is unexplainable.
